thread.title: Race to replace Brendan Rodgers after Reds wield axe
thread.title_full: Race to replace Brendan Rodgers after Reds wield axe

title: Race to replace Brendan Rodgers after Reds wield axe
text:
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger said Rodgers has shown he has the ability to manage at the highest level and expects to see him back in management soon. 
“I am always sad when that happens because I think he is a quality manager,” Wenger said. 
Former Liverpool captain Jamie Carragher said the club’s owners must get the next appointment right, and suggested Rodgers should have gone sooner. 
“He will know himself he had to make a big start (to the current season)and he hasn’t so that’s where the pressure comes from,” Carragher said. 
“He’s been there three and a bit years, they haven’t won a trophy and they’ve played Champions League football once. That’s not good enough for Liverpool.” More on this story:
